intro: Canthium subsessilifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb with simple, alternate leaves that are usually narrow and sessile. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, a unique structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
